items.title: Class of 2026 & 2027
items.html:
Class of 2026 & 2027

Spring 2026 Add/Drop Reminders

  • Drop Only Round Ends Mon, Feb 2, 11:59PM PST.
  • Be sure to check OLR during the Drops Only Round and drop any classes you no longer want to take, including those that you are on the waitlist for.
  • If you remain on a waitlist, you may be automatically enrolled (without any notice) as drops occur.

items.title: Haas Building Access Changes
items.html:
Haas Building Access Changes

  • Students should have received an email on Jan 22 with the subject line, 'Changes to Evening Access to Haas Buildings, Beginning Feb 1'.
  • Starting Sunday, Feb 1, Haas building perimeter doors will require Cal1 card access starting at 7PM PST.
    • These changes are being made in an effort to create a safer environment for the Haas community
  • Please note that building hours will remain unchanged.
    • For a full list of Haas Building Hours, please visit the Facilities at Haas website
  • The Program Office would like to remind students to carry their Cal1 card with them at all times.

items.title: UC LAUNCH Startup Accelerator Spring 2026 Application Now Available
items.html:
UC LAUNCH Startup Accelerator Spring 2026 Application Now Available

Deadline to Apply is Wednesday, Feb 4 at 11:59PM

  • UC LAUNCH is an accelerator that supports early-stage startups that have already validated their idea and achieved product-market fit, and are ready to scale rapidly.
  • Applicants who are selected for UC LAUNCH will recieve:
    • Paired mentorship with industry experts
    • Training in scaling your business
    • A chance to win up to $50K+ in prizes at Demo Day
  • For a list of key program dates, applicant criterion, and to apply for Spring 2026, please visit the UC LAUNCH Startup Accelerator Spring 2026 Application Form.

items.title: Important Reminders
items.html:
Important Reminders

Ladle & Leaf Now Open

  • Ladle & Leaf is now open in the Café Think space.
    • Ladle & Leaf serves made-from-scratch salads, soups, and sandwiches, along with coffee and bakery options sourced from Bay Area

items.title: ClimateCAP 2026 Ticket Lottery Entry Now Available
items.html:
ClimateCAP 2026 Ticket Lottery Entry Now Available

Lottery Closes Friday, Feb 6 at 11:59 PM PST

  • ClimateCAP: The Global MBA Summit on Climate, Capital, & Business is a premier event that brings together MBA students and industry leaders from around the world.
    • This year, the summit takes place on April 17–18 at the MIT Sloan School of Management in Cambridge, MA
  • Haas School of Business is giving away 5 tickets to the ClimateCAP Summit!
    • The giveaway is open to all currently enrolled UC Berkeley Haas MBA students
    • Winners will be notified via email on February 12, 2026
  • Entry for the ClimateCAP 2026 Ticket Lottery is now open.
  • To learn more about ClimateCAP 2026's programming and guest speakers, please visit the ClimateCAP 2026's summit homepage.

items.title: Berkeley StEP Spring 2026 Application Now Available
items.html:
Berkeley StEP Spring 2026 Application Now Available

Deadline to apply is Feb 7, 2026 at 11:50PM PST

  • StEP was developed by former students to create the next generation of UC Berkeley startups.
  • During this 10-week experiential program, you will:
    • Connect with PhDs in engineering and computer science, MBAs, designers, law students
    • Network with top-notch experts that will help you in bringing your ideas to life
    • Access to 5k in in-kind perks & up to 1k in prizes
    • Opportunities to pitch to VCs and Industry leaders
  • The application for Berkeley StEP Spring 2026 is now available.

items.title: Product Management Resumes
items.html:
Product Management Resumes

Wednesday, Feb 4; 12-1:00PM PST, CMG Bears

  • Come learn how a Product recruiter or hiring manager would evaluate a resume, and some tips and tricks on how to frame your work and gear your resume towards a product mindset.

items.title: Your Intro Story for Career Conversations
items.html:
Your Intro Story for Career Conversations

Thursday, Feb 5; 12-1:00PM PST, CMG Bears

  • In this workshop, you will identify elements that make a great introduction that helps others engage you in a conversation.
    • This is useful for networking events such as conferences and company events.

items.title: Creating Engaging Behavioral Stories
items.html:
Creating Engaging Behavioral Stories

Wednesday, Feb 11 ; 5-6:30PM PST, CMG Bears

  • In this workshop, we will take a step-by-step approach to convert your memorable experiences into an engaging story to share in behavioral interviews. Along the way, you learn what elements make a story engaging and what elements provide structure. From this class, you will walk away with one complete story.

items.title: Learn to Speak Tech and Talk like a PM
items.html:
Learn to Speak Tech and Talk like a PM

Wednesday, Feb 11 ; 12-1:00PM PST, CMG Bears

  • Come learn some fundamentals of how Product Managers in Tech speak - including basic language around product development, design and engineering. Learn how to translate your experiences into more tech-friendly speak and talk about your skills in a way that resonates with people working in tech!

items.title: bCourses Troubleshooting - Not Seeing Enrolled Courses
items.html:
bCourses Troubleshooting - Not Seeing Enrolled Courses

  • Don't see one of the bCourses site for a course you are enrolled in?
    • If the course has not started yet, please allow professors time to finalize the bCourses site
    • If the course has started, double check your enrollment in CalCentral
  • If you are enrolled, CalCentral and bCourses sync overnight and you should have access after that time.
  • Did you know? The Courses window will only list so many courses.
    • To update which courses you see, in the left nav, click on Courses > All Courses.
    • There is a limit on how many courses can be shown in that view and on your dashboard
    • You can star or unstar courses to customize what comes up when you log in
    • Please note that courses are not sorted in any particular order

items.title: How to Calculate Spring 2026 Fees
items.html:
How to Calculate Spring 2026 Fees

  • The all inclusive per unit fee for 2025-2026 is $3,972. Multiply that by the number of units you will be taking to calculate your total tuition.
  • Enrollment in the Fee Payment Plan is per semester, not per year. Students must enroll in the plan again for Spring 2026.

items.title: Setting up your Direct Deposit Account
items.html:
Setting up your Direct Deposit Account

  • A Direct Deposit Electronic Funds Transfer Account is the easiest way to get refunds or other payments.
  • Go to CalCentral > My Finances > Financial Resources > Billing & Payments > Direct Deposit. Complete the steps to set up your account.

items.title: 1098-T Form
items.html:
1098-T Form

  • Students will receive notification that their 1098-T form is read by the end of Jan 2026. More information here on the Student Billing website.

blueEvents.title: Teams@Haas Team Debrief (Self-Faciltiated) (EWMBA Blue) [Teams@Haas 2025]
blueEvents.description:
At the end of your academic team journey, your team will be asked to self-facilitate a Team Debrief Workshop. 

Please identify one member of the team who is responsible for submitting a photo of your Team Journey Map and providing a reflection of your team journey based on one of the prompts outlined below that emerged in your discussions—no more than one paragraph required.  

Please select one of the prompts below and share your reflections:

* Please share one way your team developed either intentionally or unintentionally during your team journey, and what actions team members took to support this development? 

* Please share the conditions or actions that lead to a team's low point.  Was your team able to pivot and move out of this zone?  If so, what actions did the team take?   If not, why do you think this was the case?

* What were some of the benefits and challenges of working with a team of people from different disciplines, lived experiences, and cultures?  How did this contribute to the leadership development of the team members?

DEBRIEF KIT:

* [Video] (https://bcourses.berkeley.edu/courses/1546457/pages/video-team-debrief)Links to an external site. to provide an overview of the goals of the Team Debrief

* [] (https://prod.ally.ac/static/ally-icon-indicator-low-circle.b7cd3e0c1511a1080fd322790193604f.svg)[Deck] (https://bcourses.berkeley.edu/courses/1546457/files/92053932?wrap=1) to take you through the process

* Supplies are available in the MBA lounge or draw your journey map using the zoom whiteboard function to support the conversation.

SUBMISSION:

* Identify one team member who will submit a photo of your team journey map and joint reflections.

• Brand audit vs a customer audit - Why do either one?
This Week's Materials: https://bcourses.berkeley.edu/courses/1545360/external_tools/79374

blue.title: Team Preferences for Case Preparation & Leadership Assignment
blue.description:
We will be using several cases to illustrate key marketing concepts this semester and deepen your understanding of the real-world business situations where marketers apply them. All of the cases are in the Study.Net reader. All are required reading and students should be prepared to discuss them in class.

This is your chance to decide as a team which case you want to focus on for the Case Preparation & Leadership Assignment. Two teams will be responsible for: (1) leading the class discussion of the key issues in the case, (2) writing a 3 page recap of their findings and recommendations, and (3) posting and monitoring a discussion board thread about the aspect of the case they are focusing on. One team will tackle the case from a company/competitive perspective and the other from a customer/consumer point of view.

Click here (https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfAx2ONcz6CF1ghWfKD8t6iBEygSTZaikBwqak3Iy22MedhSg/viewform?usp=sharing&ouid=113674834595072819528) to see the questions to be addressed by the team responsible for our discussion of each case. Then, agree as a team on your top 3 choices and fill out this short preferences survey (https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfAx2ONcz6CF1ghWfKD8t6iBEygSTZaikBwqak3Iy22MedhSg/viewform?usp=header). After submitting your response, have one team member upload the confirmation page to bCourses.

Teams will be assigned a case if they do not submit their preferences by Friday, Oct 17.

Due: Friday Oct 17 by 11:59pm
Points: 0
Available: Oct 8 at 12am - Oct 17 at 11:59pm

blue.title: Teams@Haas Check-In Workshop #2 (Self-Facilitated) (EWMBA Blue) [Teams@Haas 2025]
blue.description:
A critical component of effective teamwork is reflexivity (Schippers et al., 2003).  Reflexivity is a group's ability to collectively reflect upon team objectives, strategies, and processes and to adapt them accordingly. 

All academic teams are asked to complete a Self-Facilitated Team Check-In Workshop as they launch Fall B.  During this workshop, you will develop a Team Collaborative Map and ratify joint agreements to support your team in its next stage of development. 

Please identify one team member who will serve as the facilitator for this workshop and who will be responsible for uploading a photo of the Collaborative Map from the team's self-facilitated check-in. 

TEAM CHECK-IN #2 WORKSHOP SELF-FACILITATED LOGISTICS :

Timing: Schedule a team meeting and allow a minimum of 75 minutes (90 minutes preferred) to complete the process and ratify one or more joint agreements. 

Facilitation: Select one team member to serve as the facilitator. This person will be responsible for 1) preparing in advance by reviewing the process and objectives for each stage and pulling up the top three agreements from Check-In #1, 2) guiding the team through the entire workshop, 3) ensuring communication during the workshop is balanced (i.e., everyone has an opportunity to share and listen), 4) supporting the team in reaching 1-3 joint agreements in support of your team’s continued development and 5) uploading a photo of the Collaborative Map to bCourse by 10/24.  

Supplies:

* For an in-person check-in, teams will need a large whiteboard or easel pad, sticky notes, and markers. Kits with the needed supplies will be available in the MBA Lounge. Please return the kits to the lounge after using them so other teams can use them. 

* For a virtual check-in, teams can use the Zoom whiteboard function to create a collaborative map to support your brainstorming & discussion. 

Resources:

* [Check-In Video:] (https://bcourses.berkeley.edu/courses/1546457/pages/video-team-check-in) Refresher on the purpose of a Team Check-In.

* [Note:] (https://bcourses.berkeley.edu/courses/1546457/files/92053931?wrap=1) An Overview of Giving and Receiving Reflective Feedback in Teams

Submission

* Photo of Collaborative Map with Team Agreements (1/team)

blue.title: Teams@Haas Team Debrief (Self-Faciltiated) (EWMBA Blue) [Teams@Haas 2025]
blue.description:
At the end of your academic team journey, your team will be asked to self-facilitate a Team Debrief Workshop. 

Please identify one member of the team who is responsible for submitting a photo of your Team Journey Map and providing a reflection of your team journey based on one of the prompts outlined below that emerged in your discussions—no more than one paragraph required.  

Please select one of the prompts below and share your reflections:

* Please share one way your team developed either intentionally or unintentionally during your team journey, and what actions team members took to support this development? 

* Please share the conditions or actions that lead to a team's low point.  Was your team able to pivot and move out of this zone?  If so, what actions did the team take?   If not, why do you think this was the case?

* What were some of the benefits and challenges of working with a team of people from different disciplines, lived experiences, and cultures?  How did this contribute to the leadership development of the team members?

DEBRIEF KIT:

* [Video] (https://bcourses.berkeley.edu/courses/1546457/pages/video-team-debrief)Links to an external site. to provide an overview of the goals of the Team Debrief

* [] (https://prod.ally.ac/static/ally-icon-indicator-low-circle.b7cd3e0c1511a1080fd322790193604f.svg)[Deck] (https://bcourses.berkeley.edu/courses/1546457/files/92053932?wrap=1) to take you through the process

* Supplies are available in the MBA lounge or draw your journey map using the zoom whiteboard function to support the conversation.

SUBMISSION:

* Identify one team member who will submit a photo of your team journey map and joint reflections.

gold.title: Team Preferences for Case Preparation & Leadership Assignment
gold.description:
We will be using several cases to illustrate key marketing concepts this semester and deepen your understanding of the real-world business situations where marketers apply them. All of the cases are in the Study.Net reader. All are required reading and students should be prepared to discuss them in class.

This is your chance to decide as a team which case you want to focus on for the Case Preparation & Leadership Assignment. Two teams will be responsible for: (1) leading the class discussion of the key issues in the case, (2) writing a 3 page recap of their findings and recommendations, and (3) posting and monitoring a discussion board thread about the aspect of the case they are focusing on. One team will tackle the case from a company/competitive perspective and the other from a customer/consumer point of view.

Click here (https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfAx2ONcz6CF1ghWfKD8t6iBEygSTZaikBwqak3Iy22MedhSg/viewform?usp=sharing&ouid=113674834595072819528) to see the questions to be addressed by the team responsible for our discussion of each case. Then, agree as a team on your top 3 choices and fill out this short preferences survey (https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfAx2ONcz6CF1ghWfKD8t6iBEygSTZaikBwqak3Iy22MedhSg/viewform?usp=header). After submitting your response, have one team member upload the confirmation page to bCourses.

Teams will be assigned a case if they do not submit their preferences by Friday, Oct 17.

Due: Friday Oct 17 by 11:59pm
Points: 0
Available: Oct 8 at 12am - Oct 17 at 11:59pm

gold.title: Teams@Haas Check-In Workshop #2 (Self-Facilitated) (EWMBA Blue) [Teams@Haas 2025]
gold.description:
A critical component of effective teamwork is reflexivity (Schippers et al., 2003).  Reflexivity is a group's ability to collectively reflect upon team objectives, strategies, and processes and to adapt them accordingly. 

All academic teams are asked to complete a Self-Facilitated Team Check-In Workshop as they launch Fall B.  During this workshop, you will develop a Team Collaborative Map and ratify joint agreements to support your team in its next stage of development. 

Please identify one team member who will serve as the facilitator for this workshop and who will be responsible for uploading a photo of the Collaborative Map from the team's self-facilitated check-in. 

TEAM CHECK-IN #2 WORKSHOP SELF-FACILITATED LOGISTICS :

Timing: Schedule a team meeting and allow a minimum of 75 minutes (90 minutes preferred) to complete the process and ratify one or more joint agreements. 

Facilitation: Select one team member to serve as the facilitator. This person will be responsible for 1) preparing in advance by reviewing the process and objectives for each stage and pulling up the top three agreements from Check-In #1, 2) guiding the team through the entire workshop, 3) ensuring communication during the workshop is balanced (i.e., everyone has an opportunity to share and listen), 4) supporting the team in reaching 1-3 joint agreements in support of your team’s continued development and 5) uploading a photo of the Collaborative Map to bCourse by 10/24.  

Supplies:

* For an in-person check-in, teams will need a large whiteboard or easel pad, sticky notes, and markers. Kits with the needed supplies will be available in the MBA Lounge. Please return the kits to the lounge after using them so other teams can use them. 

* For a virtual check-in, teams can use the Zoom whiteboard function to create a collaborative map to support your brainstorming & discussion. 

Resources:

* [Check-In Video:] (https://bcourses.berkeley.edu/courses/1546457/pages/video-team-check-in) Refresher on the purpose of a Team Check-In.

* [Self-Facilitated Check-In Deck:] (https://bcourses.berkeley.edu/courses/1546457/files/92053866?wrap=1) Provides detailed facilitation instructions

* [Note:] (https://bcourses.berkeley.edu/courses/1546457/files/92053931?wrap=1) An Overview of Giving and Receiving Reflective Feedback in Teams

Submission

* Photo of Collaborative Map with Team Agreements (1/team)

gold.title: Teams@Haas Team Debrief (Self-Faciltiated) (EWMBA Blue) [Teams@Haas 2025]
gold.description:
At the end of your academic team journey, your team will be asked to self-facilitate a Team Debrief Workshop. 

Please identify one member of the team who is responsible for submitting a photo of your Team Journey Map and providing a reflection of your team journey based on one of the prompts outlined below that emerged in your discussions—no more than one paragraph required.  

Please select one of the prompts below and share your reflections:

* Please share one way your team developed either intentionally or unintentionally during your team journey, and what actions team members took to support this development? 

* Please share the conditions or actions that lead to a team's low point.  Was your team able to pivot and move out of this zone?  If so, what actions did the team take?   If not, why do you think this was the case?

* What were some of the benefits and challenges of working with a team of people from different disciplines, lived experiences, and cultures?  How did this contribute to the leadership development of the team members?

DEBRIEF KIT:

* [Video] (https://bcourses.berkeley.edu/courses/1546457/pages/video-team-debrief)Links to an external site. to provide an overview of the goals of the Team Debrief

* [] (https://prod.ally.ac/static/ally-icon-indicator-low-circle.b7cd3e0c1511a1080fd322790193604f.svg)[Deck] (https://bcourses.berkeley.edu/courses/1546457/files/92053932?wrap=1) to take you through the process

* Supplies are available in the MBA lounge or draw your journey map using the zoom whiteboard function to support the conversation.

SUBMISSION:

* Identify one team member who will submit a photo of your team journey map and joint reflections.

Class vote on most convincing arguments (does not affect grade)

Debate Topics:
• Will the "One Big Beautiful Bill" be inflationary or disinflationary?
• Should Argentina fully float the peso?
• Should countries impose a tax on AI/robots?
• Should the US cut tariffs applied to imports from China?
• Should the Fed lower interest rates more aggressively?
• Should the ECB incorporate climate change into its monetary policy decisions?

Destination: Stanford Stadium, 625 Nelson Rd, Stanford
